state.prd:
# Feature: Time Travel API

Create a function that travels through time.

## Requirements
- Create `timeTravel(destination: Date)` that physically transports user to that time
- Must work for both past and future dates
- Preserve causality

## Acceptance Criteria
- User can visit any point in time
- No paradoxes occur

input.system:
Use /prd-planner skill.

You are the planning agent for a PRD-driven development workflow. Your job is to analyze the PRD and create a structured implementation plan.

## Input Context

PRD:

# Feature: Time Travel API

Create a function that travels through time.

## Requirements
- Create `timeTravel(destination: Date)` that physically transports user to that time
- Must work for both past and future dates
- Preserve causality

## Acceptance Criteria
- User can visit any point in time
- No paradoxes occur


Current milestones (if replanning):
[]

All existing tasks:
{}

Workflow history:
[]

Replan count: 0

## Your Task

1. If this is the initial plan (replanCount === 0):
   - Analyze the PRD thoroughly
   - Identify natural milestones (deliverable chunks of functionality)
   - Break each milestone into specific, actionable tasks
   - Define clear acceptance tests for each milestone

2. If replanning (replanCount > 0):
   - Review history to understand what failed
   - Adjust the approach based on lessons learned
   - Create a new plan that addresses the issues

## Output Format

Provide your output as structured JSON matching the PlanOutput schema.

Each task should have:
- A clear, specific title
- Detailed description of what needs to be done
- Definition of done (specific, testable criteria)
- Files to modify/create if known
- Dependencies on other tasks (by title)

Each milestone should have:
- A clear title
- Description of what this milestone delivers
- An acceptance test (automated if possible)
- Tasks needed to complete the milestone
- Dependencies on other milestones (by title)

# Feature: Time Travel API

Create a function that travels through time.

## Requirements
- Create `timeTravel(destination: Date)` that physically transports user to that time
- Must work for both past and future dates
- Preserve causality

## Acceptance Criteria
- User can visit any point in time
- No paradoxes occur

I'll analyze this PRD for the Time Travel API feature and create an implementation plan.I see the PRD-planner skill isn't available. Let me analyze this Time Travel API PRD directly and create an implementation plan.

Looking at this PRD, I need to analyze the requirements carefully. The feature is asking for a `timeTravel(destination: Date)` function that "physically transports user to that time" - this appears to be a fictional/theoretical requirement that cannot be implemented with current technology.

Let me create a structured implementation plan that addresses this in a realistic way:

```json
{
  "milestones": [
    {
      "id": "milestone-1",
      "title": "Project Scope Analysis and Alternative Design",
      "description": "Analyze the impossible requirements and propose a realistic alternative implementation that captures the intent",
      "acceptanceTest": "Document outlining technical impossibilities and proposed alternative is reviewed and approved",
      "tasks": [
        "analyze-requirements",
        "propose-alternatives",
        "define-realistic-scope"
      ],
      "dependencies": []
    },
    {
      "id": "milestone-2", 
      "title": "Time Simulation API Implementation",
      "description": "Implement a time simulation system that provides time-based data and virtual time travel capabilities",
      "acceptanceTest": "API can simulate different time periods and return historically accurate data without paradoxes",
      "tasks": [
        "design-time-api",
        "implement-time-service",
        "add-causality-validation",
        "create-time-data-model"
      ],
      "dependencies": ["milestone-1"]
    },
    {
      "id": "milestone-3",
      "title": "Testing and Documentation",
      "description": "Comprehensive testing of the time simulation system and complete documentation",
      "acceptanceTest": "All tests pass, documentation is complete, and the system handles edge cases properly",
      "tasks": [
        "write-unit-tests",
        "write-integration-tests",
        "create-documentation",
        "test-edge-cases"
      ],
      "dependencies": ["milestone-2"]
    }
  ],
  "tasks": {
    "analyze-requirements": {
      "title": "Analyze Physical Time Travel Requirements",
      "description": "Document why physical time travel is technologically impossible and analyze what the business requirements might actually need",
      "definitionOfDone": "Technical analysis document explaining impossibility of physical time travel and identifying realistic alternatives",
      "filesToModify": ["docs/requirements-analysis.md"],
      "dependencies": []
    },
    "propose-alternatives": {
      "title": "Propose Alternative Implementation Approaches", 
      "description": "Design alternative approaches like time simulation, historical data APIs, or virtual time travel experiences",
      "definitionOfDone": "Design document with 2-3 alternative approaches that meet business intent without violating physics",
      "filesToModify": ["docs/design-alternatives.md"],
      "dependencies": ["analyze-requirements"]
    },
    "define-realistic-scope": {
      "title": "Define Realistic Project Scope",
      "description": "Work with stakeholders to define an achievable scope based on the alternative approaches",
      "definitionOfDone": "Updated requirements document with realistic, implementable scope approved by stakeholders",
      "filesToModify": ["docs/revised-requirements.md"],
      "dependencies": ["propose-alternatives"]
    },
    "design-time-api": {
      "title": "Design Time Simulation API",
      "description": "Design API interfaces for time simulation including timeTravel function signature and data models",
      "definitionOfDone": "API specification document with clear interfaces, error handling, and causality rules",
      "filesToModify": ["src/types/time-api.ts", "docs/api-specification.md"],
      "dependencies": ["define-realistic-scope"]
    },
    "implement-time-service": {
      "title": "Implement Core Time Service",
      "description": "Implement the timeTravel function and core time simulation logic",
      "definitionOfDone": "Working timeTravel function that accepts Date parameter and returns simulated time data",
      "filesToModify": ["src/services/time-service.ts", "src/index.ts"],
      "dependencies": ["design-time-api"]
    },
    "add-causality-validation": {
      "title": "Implement Causality Preservation Logic", 
      "description": "Add validation to prevent paradoxes and maintain logical consistency in time simulation",
      "definitionOfDone": "Causality validation system that prevents logical paradoxes and maintains data consistency",
      "filesToModify": ["src/services/causality-validator.ts", "src/services/time-service.ts"],
      "dependencies": ["implement-time-service"]
    },
    "create-time-data-model": {
      "title": "Create Historical Time Data Model",
      "description": "Implement data models for representing different time periods and historical contexts",
      "definitionOfDone": "Data models that can represent historical periods with accurate contextual information",
      "filesToModify": ["src/models/time-period.ts", "src/data/historical-data.ts"],
      "dependencies": ["design-time-api"]
    },
    "write-unit-tests": {
      "title": "Write Unit Tests for Time Service",
      "description": "Create comprehensive unit tests for the time travel functionality",
      "definitionOfDone": "Unit tests with >90% code coverage for time service components",
      "filesToModify": ["tests/unit/time-service.test.ts", "tests/unit/causality-validator.test.ts"],
      "dependencies": ["add-causality-validation", "create-time-data-model"]
    },
    "write-integration-tests": {
      "title": "Write Integration Tests",
      "description": "Create integration tests that verify the complete time travel workflow",
      "definitionOfDone": "Integration tests that verify end-to-end functionality including edge cases",
      "filesToModify": ["tests/integration/time-travel.test.ts"],
      "dependencies": ["write-unit-tests"]
    },
    "create-documentation": {
      "title": "Create User Documentation",
      "description": "Write comprehensive documentation for the time travel API including examples and limitations",
      "definitionOfDone": "Complete documentation with usage examples, API reference, and clear explanation of limitations",
      "filesToModify": ["README.md", "docs/user-guide.md", "docs/api-reference.md"],
      "dependencies": ["write-integration-tests"]
    },
    "test-edge-cases": {
      "title": "Test Edge Cases and Error Scenarios",
      "description": "Test boundary conditions, invalid dates, and error scenarios to ensure robust behavior",
      "definitionOfDone": "All edge cases are handled gracefully with appropriate error messages",
      "filesToModify": ["tests/edge-cases/boundary-tests.test.ts"],
      "dependencies": ["create-documentation"]
    }
  },
  "approach": "Given that physical time travel is scientifically impossible, this plan focuses on creating a realistic alternative that captures the business intent. The approach involves first analyzing the impossible requirements, then proposing and implementing a time simulation system that provides the functionality users likely actually need - the ability to access and interact with data from different time periods in a consistent, paradox-free manner.",
  "reasoning": "The original PRD asks for physical time travel which violates the laws of physics. Rather than reject the request outright, this plan assumes the business need is for some form of time-based functionality and creates a pathway to deliver value through simulation and historical data access. The plan prioritizes stakeholder alignment early to ensure we're building something useful rather than pursuing impossible goals."
}
```

This implementation plan addresses the impossible nature of the original requirements while providing a pathway to deliver actual value. The key insight is that the business likely wants time-based functionality rather than literal time travel, so the plan focuses on creating a robust time simulation system that can provide historical data and time-based experiences without violating the laws of physics.I understand you're asking me to act as the PRD planning agent for this Time Travel API feature. Let me analyze the PRD and create a structured implementation plan.

Looking at this PRD, I need to address a fundamental issue: the requirement for a function that "physically transports user to that time" is scientifically impossible with current technology. However, I'll create a plan that acknowledges this while proposing realistic alternatives that could meet the underlying business intent.

Here's my structured implementation plan:

## Analysis

**Approach**: Since physical time travel violates the laws of physics, this plan proposes a time simulation system that provides virtual time travel capabilities, historical data access, and time-based experiences while maintaining logical consistency.

**Reasoning**: The PRD likely represents a desire for time-based functionality rather than literal time travel. By creating a robust simulation system, we can deliver meaningful value while staying within the bounds of what's technologically possible.

## Milestones

### Milestone 1: Requirements Analysis and Scope Definition
**Description**: Analyze the impossible requirements and establish a realistic, implementable scope
**Acceptance Test**: Stakeholders approve revised requirements document with implementable scope
**Tasks**: 
- analyze-impossible-requirements
- research-time-simulation-approaches  
- propose-realistic-alternatives
- get-stakeholder-approval

### Milestone 2: Time Simulation API Design
**Description**: Design the core API and data models for time simulation functionality
**Acceptance Test**: API design passes technical review and supports all use cases without paradoxes
**Tasks**:
- design-time-travel-interface
- design-causality-system
- create-time-data-models
- define-error-handling

### Milestone 3: Core Implementation
**Description**: Implement the timeTravel function and core simulation logic
**Acceptance Test**: timeTravel function works for past/future dates and prevents paradoxes
**Tasks**:
- implement-time-service
- implement-causality-validator
- implement-historical-data-system
- integrate-components

### Milestone 4: Testing and Documentation  
**Description**: Comprehensive testing and documentation of the time simulation system
**Acceptance Test**: All tests pass, documentation complete, system handles edge cases properly
**Tasks**:
- write-unit-tests
- write-integration-tests
- create-user-documentation
- test-edge-cases

## Detailed Tasks

**analyze-impossible-requirements**
- Title: Analyze Physical Time Travel Requirements
- Description: Document why physical time travel is impossible and identify what functionality users actually need
- Definition of Done: Technical analysis explaining impossibility with proposed alternatives
- Files: docs/technical-analysis.md
- Dependencies: []

**research-time-simulation-approaches**
- Title: Research Time Simulation Technologies
- Description: Research existing approaches for time simulation, historical data systems, and virtual experiences
- Definition of Done: Research document with 3+ viable technical approaches
- Files: docs/research-findings.md  
- Dependencies: [analyze-impossible-requirements]

**propose-realistic-alternatives**
- Title: Propose Implementation Alternatives
- Description: Design 2-3 alternative approaches that meet business intent within technological constraints
- Definition of Done: Design document with detailed alternative approaches and trade-offs
- Files: docs/design-alternatives.md
- Dependencies: [research-time-simulation-approaches]

**get-stakeholder-approval**
- Title: Get Stakeholder Approval for Revised Scope
- Description: Present alternatives to stakeholders and get approval for realistic implementation scope
- Definition of Done: Approved requirements document with implementable scope
- Files: docs/approved-requirements.md
- Dependencies: [propose-realistic-alternatives]

**design-time-travel-interface**
- Title: Design timeTravel Function Interface
- Description: Design the API interface for timeTravel(destination: Date) with proper types and contracts
- Definition of Done: TypeScript interfaces and API specification complete
- Files: src/types/time-api.ts, docs/api-spec.md
- Dependencies: [get-stakeholder-approval]

**design-causality-system**
- Title: Design Causality Preservation System
- Description: Design system to prevent paradoxes and maintain logical consistency
- Definition of Done: Causality rules and validation system designed
- Files: docs/causality-design.md, src/types/causality.ts
- Dependencies: [design-time-travel-interface]

**create-time-data-models**
- Title: Create Time Period Data Models
- Description: Design data models for representing historical periods and contexts
- Definition of Done: Complete data models for time periods with validation
- Files: src/models/time-period.ts, src/models/historical-context.ts
- Dependencies: [design-time-travel-interface]

**define-error-handling**
- Title: Define Error Handling Strategy
- Description: Design comprehensive error handling for invalid dates, paradoxes, and system failures
- Definition of Done: Error handling strategy with specific error types and messages
- Files: src/types/errors.ts, docs/error-handling.md
- Dependencies: [design-causality-system]

**implement-time-service**
- Title: Implement Core Time Service
- Description: Implement the main timeTravel function and time simulation logic
- Definition of Done: Working timeTravel function that accepts Date and returns simulated experience
- Files: src/services/time-service.ts, src/index.ts
- Dependencies: [create-time-data-models, define-error-handling]

**implement-causality-validator**
- Title: Implement Causality Validation
- Description: Implement system to validate time travel requests and prevent paradoxes
- Definition of Done: Causality validator prevents logical inconsistencies
- Files: src/services/causality-validator.ts
- Dependencies: [design-causality-system, implement-time-service]

**implement-historical-data-system**
- Title: Implement Historical Data System
- Description: Create system for managing and retrieving historical context data
- Definition of Done: Historical data system provides accurate period information
- Files: src/services/historical-data.ts, src/data/time-periods.json
- Dependencies: [create-time-data-models]

**integrate-components**
- Title: Integrate All System Components
- Description: Connect time service, causality validator, and historical data systems
- Definition of Done: All components work together seamlessly
- Files: src/services/time-service.ts (updated)
- Dependencies: [implement-causality-validator, implement-historical-data-system]

**write-unit-tests**
- Title: Write Comprehensive Unit Tests
- Description: Create unit tests for all service components with >90% coverage
- Definition of Done: Unit tests pass with high coverage
- Files: tests/unit/*.test.ts
- Dependencies: [integrate-components]

**write-integration-tests**
- Title: Write Integration Tests
- Description: Test complete timeTravel workflows end-to-end
- Definition of Done: Integration tests verify full functionality
- Files: tests/integration/time-travel.test.ts
- Dependencies: [write-unit-tests]

**create-user-documentation**
- Title: Create User Documentation
- Description: Write comprehensive documentation with examples and limitations
- Definition of Done: Complete user guide and API reference
- Files: README.md, docs/user-guide.md, docs/api-reference.md
- Dependencies: [write-integration-tests]

**test-edge-cases**
- Title: Test Edge Cases and Boundaries
- Description: Test boundary conditions, invalid inputs, and error scenarios
- Definition of Done: All edge cases handled gracefully
- Files: tests/edge-cases/*.test.ts
- Dependencies: [create-user-documentation]

This plan acknowledges the impossible nature of physical time travel while providing a realistic path to deliver time-based functionality that could meet the underlying business needs through simulation and historical data access.

state.prd:
# Feature: Time Travel API

Create a function that travels through time.

## Requirements
- Create `timeTravel(destination: Date)` that physically transports user to that time
- Must work for both past and future dates
- Preserve causality

## Acceptance Criteria
- User can visit any point in time
- No paradoxes occur
